meanings.definition: A person who repairs or fixes something.
meanings.sent1: The mender fixed my torn shirt.
meanings.sent2: The skilled mender repaired the broken chair.
meanings.sent3: The friendly mender joked that even clothes need a doctor sometimes.
meanings.sent4: She was a mender of hearts, stitching together broken relationships.
meanings.sent5: The diligent mender carefully weaved the threads back together.

meanings.sent1: I will mender the hole in my sock.
meanings.sent2: She menders broken toys for the children.
meanings.sent3: He tried to mender the situation with a joke, but it only made things worse.
meanings.sent4: Time can mender wounds, healing even the deepest scars.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic skillfully menders engines, making them run smoothly again.
